newsitem.title: DENMARK: NatWest give buy rating to Danish BG Bank.
newsitem.headline: NatWest give buy rating to Danish BG Bank.

text.p: Britain's NatWest Securities on Friday gave a 'buy' recommendation among Danish banks to BG Bank, compared to 'hold' recommendations on Den Danske Bank and Unidanmark.

"While the overall sector outlook is mixed, our key recommendation is BG Bank, which is expected to use its large stock of excess capital more effectively than Unidanmnark or Den Danske Bank," NatWest wrote in a report.
"BG Bank has the most scope to improve cost efficiency and reduce loan loss provisions, its valuation looks compelling on fundamentals," it said.
NatWest noted that BG Bank had a higher price earnings ratio than the two larger banks.
"On a number of valuation levels, the shares look cheap, particularly given that we expect BG Bank's profitability to exceed that of the sector," NatWest said.
BG Bank is Denmark's third biggest, Den Danske Bank the biggest, followed by Unidanmark in second position.
BG Bank was the only one of Denmark's top three banks to report a rise in 1996 profits. --Chris Follett, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33969652
